intro: Phlomoides milingensis, commonly known as the Milingensis false foxglove, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale purple or blue in color. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in grasslands and along riverbanks. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
